name: Phosphorus trifluoride
desc: Phosphorus trifluoride (formula PF3), is a colorless and odorless gas. It is highly toxic and reacts slowly with water. Its main use is as a ligand in metal complexes. As a ligand, it parallels carbon monoxide in metal carbonyls, and indeed its toxicity is due to its binding with the iron in blood hemoglobin in a similar way to carbon monoxide.

images.alt: Structure and dimensions of phosphorus trifluoride

Phosphorus trifluoride
Phosphorus(III) fluoride
Trifluorophosphane
Trifluoridophosphorus
Other anions:

Other cations:

Arsenic trifluoride

Bismuth trifluoride
